snippet: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan left an African Union meeting in Nigeria after human rights groups filed a suit calling for his arrest on a warrant accusing him of genocide.
abstract: Sudan's Pres Omar Hassan al-Bashir appears briefly at African Union summit meeting in Nigeria but vanishes after human rights groups file lawsuit calling for his immediate detention on international arrest warrant for charges of genocide; International Criminal Court in Hague issued warrant for his arrest in 2009.

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Khartoum, Sudan.

lead_paragraph: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan left an African Union meeting in Nigeria after human rights groups filed a suit calling for his arrest on a warrant accusing him of genocide.

headline.main: Sudan’s President One Step Ahead of a Suit and a Warrant
headline.print_headline: Sudan’s President One Step Ahead of a Suit and a Warrant

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
